title: Tigers Sign Framber Valdez to Record Three Year
snippets: Framber Valdez and the Tigers are in agreement on a three-year, $115 million contract, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan, the highest average annual value ever for a left-handed pitcher.
Free agent pitcher Framber Valdez and the Detroit Tigers have agreed to a $115-million, three-year contract, a person familiar with the situation told The Associated Press on Wednesday night.
Valdez is a two-time All-Star and 2022 World Series champion. He was Houston’s ace last season with a 13-11 record and 3.66 ERA.
This is a huge move that puts the Tigers rotation at the top of the game.
The top remaining free agent pitcher has a new home.
Framber Valdez hit free agency coming off one of his worst seasons in the majors.
The Detroit Tigers are signing left-handed pitcher Framber Valdez. He'll pair with Tarik Skubal to lead the Tigers rotation in 2026.
Meanwhile, Eugenio Suarez and Luis Arraez land in favorable spots
Framber Valdez, formerly the top available free agent pitcher, surprised the baseball world by signing with the Detroit Tigers.
Heading into what might be Tarik Skubal's final season in Detroit, the Tigers' only major offseason moves had involved relievers, returners or both.
